get.summary: Return a summary of assignments delivered for an experiment
Return a summary of assignments delivered for an experiment
A wrapper for POST /counts API with default parameters

post.summary: Return a summary of the data collected for the experiment
post.description: Return unique and non-unique counts at the experiment, bucket, and action levels for both actions and impressions.

get.summary: A wrapper for POST /counts/dailies API with default parameters

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: context for the experiment, eg QA, PROD

post.summary: Return a daily summary of the data collected for the experiment
post.description: Return unique and non-unique counts at the experiment, bucket, and action levels for both actions and impressions. For each day, includes counts for that day and cumulative counts, calculated from the beginning of the experiment.

get.summary: A wrapper for POST /statistics API with default parameters

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: context for the experiment, eg QA, PROD

post.summary: Return a summary of the data collected for the experiment with derived statistics
post.description: Return unique and non-unique counts at the experiment, bucket, and action levels for both actions and impressions. Also returns a number of statistics calculated from the unique counts.

get.summary: A wrapper for POST /statistics/dailies API with default parameters

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: context for the experiment, eg QA, PROD

post.summary: Return a daily summary of the data collected for the experiment with derived statistics
post.description: Return unique and non-unique counts at the experiment, bucket, and action levels for both actions and impressions. For each day, includes counts for that day and cumulative counts, calculated from the beginning of the experiment. Also returns a number of statistics calculated from the unique counts.

get.description: The experiments returned belong to a single application

get.summary: Get the priority list for an application
get.description: The returned priority list is rank ordered.

get.summary: Return bucket assignment for a user
get.description: Generate the assignment first if the user has no assignment for this experiment.  Return null if the user is not in the experiment.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: context for the experiment, e.g. PROD, QA

parameters.name: createAssignment
parameters.description: whether an assignment should be generated if one doesn't exist

parameters.name: ignoreSamplingPercent
parameters.description: whether the sampling percent for the experiment should be ignored, forcing the user into the experiment (if eligible)

post.summary: Return bucket assignment for a user
post.description: Generate the assignment first if the user has no assignment for this experiment. Forces the user to be in the experiment (if eligible based on profile).

parameters.name: createAssignment
parameters.description: whether an assignment should be generated if one doesn't exist

parameters.name: ignoreSamplingPercent
parameters.description: whether the sampling percent for the experiment should be ignored, forcing the user into the experiment (if eligible)

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: context for the experiment, e.g. PROD, QA

get.summary: Return bucket assignments for a user for all the experiments associated with a page
get.description: If you want to pass segmentation information, use the POST-Call for this method

parameters.name: createAssignment
parameters.description: whether Jabba should generate an assignment if one doesn't exist

parameters.name: ignoreSamplingPercent
parameters.description: whether the sampling percent for the experiment should be ignored, forcing the user into the experiment (if eligible)

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: context for the experiment, eg QA, PROD

post.summary: Return bucket assignments for a user for all the experiments associated with a page
post.description: The mutual exclusion and segmentation rules apply

parameters.name: createAssignment
parameters.description: whether Jabba should generate an assignment if one doesn't exist

parameters.name: ignoreSamplingPercent
parameters.description: whether the sampling percent for the experiment should be ignored, forcing the user into the experiment (if eligible)

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: context for the experiment, eg QA, PROD

post.summary: Return bucket assignments for a user across multiple experiments
post.description: Generate the assignments first if the user has no assignment for the specified experiments if the CREATE flag is set to true and the user is eligible with respect to the segmentation profile. Return null if the user is not in the experiment.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: context for the experiment, eg QA, PROD

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: please enter client_credentials in this field

Check if user exists using user's email
Verify user's authorization

Get roles for all users within an application

delete.summary: Delete a user's role within an application

post.summary: Sends email to administrators of the specified application requesting access for a user
Submit a single event or a batch of events for the specified assigned user(customer)
post.description: *NOTE*: For a given user, please make sure that you have the user assignment done using the assignments API before using this API. An event is either an impression, indicating the user has been exposed to the treatment, or an action, indicating that the user has done something that you want to track. Please record impressions first and then action - use event name = "IMPRESSION" for impressions.

parameters.name: userID
parameters.description: Customer User ID that is already assigned using assignments API

post.summary: Create an experiment (and the application as well, if it doesn't exist) [review]

get.summary: Return all experiments for page for app [done]

parameters.name: pageName
parameters.description: Page name where the experiment will appear

delete.description: Can only delete mutual exclusion relations that currently exists.  This operation is symmetric

get.summary: Return details of a single experiment [done]

put.description: Can update an experiment that is in DRAFT state to change the experiment state, or to change sampling percentage or to enable personalization and more.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Please read the implementation notes above

delete.description: Can only delete an experiment that is in DRAFT or TERMINATED state.  The default call is safe to use, but other than that please only delete experiments which you have created.

get.description: Shows list of all user assignments for a given experiment ID. Returns both nullassignments as well as bucket assignments. [review]

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: context for the experiment, eg QA, PROD

get.summary: Return all buckets for an experiment [done]

post.summary: Modify a bucket for an experiment [Can only weirdly add a new bucket] [Weird]
post.description: Can only modify buckets for an experiment that is in DRAFT state.

put.description: Can only modify buckets for an experiment that is in DRAFT state.

get.summary: Return a single bucket for an experiment [done]

put.summary: Update a bucket in an experiment [done]
put.description: Can only update buckets for an experiment that is in DRAFT state.

delete.summary: Delete a bucket in an experiment [done]
delete.description: Can only delete a bucket for experiment that is in DRAFT state.  The default call is safe to use, but other than that please only delete buckets which you have created.

put.description: Can only close a bucket which is not in DRAFT state

get.summary: Export all event records for an experiment [done]
get.description: A wrapper for POST API with default parameters

post.summary: Export all event records for an experiment [review parameters]
post.description: Download all event records for a given experiment in a tab-delimited text format.

get.summary: Get list of mutually exclusive experiments [done]
get.description: Shows list of all experiments, in all states, that are mutually exclusive with input experiment.

post.summary: Create mutual exclusion rules for an experiment [List<String> not an acceptable swagger override] [review]
post.description: Can only create mutual exclusion rules for experiments in DRAFT, RUNNING, and PAUSED states within+the same application

get.summary: Get the associated pages information for a given experiment ID [done]

post.summary: Post a list of pages to an experiment [for 1 page, works - NOT recognizing a list of pages JSON] [review]
post.description: Pages can only be added to an experiment with DRAFT, RUNNING, or PAUSED states

delete.summary: Remove a page from an experiment [done]
delete.description: Pages can only be added to an experiment with DRAFT, RUNNING, or PAUSED states

parameters.name: pageName
parameters.description: Page name where the experiment will appear

post.summary: Insert an experiment into an application's priority list [done]
post.description: Experiments can only be placed in a priority list DRAFT, RUNNING, and PAUSED states withinthe same application

tags: Audit Logs (Activity Logs about changes in experiments-buckets)
get.summary: Returns all logs if the requesting user has SuperAdmin permissions.
get.description: Returns all logs if the requesting user has SuperAdmin permissions. The parameters allow for filtering, sorting, and pagination.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Allows to specify the sort order.
SortOrder    := Property | PropertyList
PropertyList := Property,SortOrder
Property     := ALProperty | -ALProperty
ALProperty   := firstname, lastname, username, mail, app, experiment, bucket, time, attr, before, after, desc, action
The prefix - allows for descending sorting.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Allows to specify filter rules.
FilterMask   := Value | Value,KeyValueList | KeyValueListKeyValueList := Property=Value | Property=Value,KeyValueListProperty     := firstname | lastname | username | mail | user | experiment | bucket | app | time | attr | before | afterValue        := any value, may not contain commas (,) followed by a Property. If it starts with an escaped                dash (\-), the value is negated, thus shall not match.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: Allows to specify the user's timezone offset to UTC. Should be in the format +0000 (or -0000). If not specified, it is handled as +0000.

tags: Audit Logs (Activity Logs about changes in experiments-buckets)
get.summary: Returns all logs for the specified application if the requesting user has Admin permissions.
get.description: Returns all logs for the specified application if the requesting user has Admin permissions. The parameters allow for filtering, sorting, and pagination.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Allows to specify the sort order.
SortOrder    := Property | PropertyList
PropertyList := Property,SortOrder
Property     := ALProperty | -ALProperty
ALProperty   := firstname, lastname, username, mail, app, experiment, bucket, time, attr, before, after, desc, action
The prefix - allows for descending sorting.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Allows to specify filter rules.
FilterMask   := Value | Value,KeyValueList | KeyValueListKeyValueList := Property=Value | Property=Value,KeyValueListProperty     := firstname | lastname | username | mail | user | experiment | bucket | app | time | attr | before | afterValue        := any value, may not contain commas (,) followed by a Property. If it starts with an escaped                dash (\-), the value is negated, thus shall not match.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: Allows to specify the user's timezone offset to UTC. Should be in the format +0000 (or -0000). Default is +0000.

get.summary: Pings the server
get.description: Also returns the status of other components. Uses metrics-healthchecks and pings/check connections to MySql and Cassandra.

eventCount.description: total number of counts (can have multiple counts per user)

uniqueUserCount.description: number of unique users with one or more counts

hasSufficientData.description: if sufficient data has been collected to observe the effect size of interest

fractionDataCollected.description: fraction of data that has been collected to observe the effect size of interest

label.description: unique bucket label in the experiment

allocationPercent.description: probability of a user being assigned this bucket if they are in the experiment; in range (0, 1]

payload.description: optional snippet of HTML, JS, etc; returned with a user bucket assignment

isControl.description: a single control bucket may be specified for each experiment

count.description: count of assignments for the bucket

jointActionCounts.description: counts for all actions treated as one

jointActionRate.description: statistics for all actions treated as one

jointActionCounts.description: counts for all actions treated as one
counts for all actions treated as one

jointActionRate.description: statistics for all actions treated as one

eventCount.description: total number of counts (can have multiple counts per user)

uniqueUserCount.description: number of unique users with one or more counts

cumulative.description: counts occurring on and prior to the date

emailLinks.description: List of clickable email links for application Admins

payload.description: payload for the event; defaults to null

label.description: experiment label; unique within the application

startTime.description: earliest time the experiment allows bucket assignments

endTime.description: latest time the experiment allows bucket assignments

samplingPercent.description: probability of an eligible user being assigned into the experiment; in range: (0, 1]

rule.description: defines a user segment, i.e., if the rule validates to true, user is part of the segment

ruleJson.description: defines a user segment in json, i.e., if the rule validates to true, user is part of the segment

isPersonalizationEnabled.description: is personalization enabled for this experiment

userCap.description: maximum number of users to allow before pausing the experiment

jointActionCounts.description: counts for all actions treated as one

jointActionRate.description: statistics for all actions treated as one

labels.description: a list of experiment labels for batch assignment

jointActionCounts.description: counts for all actions treated as one

experimentIDs.description: a list of experiment uuids for batch assignment

jointActionCounts.description: counts for all actions treated as one

jointActionRate.description: statistics for all actions treated as one

experimentProgress.description: progress metrics at the experiment level

jointProgress.description: progress metrics for all actions treated as one

actionProgress.description: progress metrics for each action individually

userCap.description: maximum number of users to allow before pausing the experiment

NewExperiment.description: Subset of Experiment used to create a new experiment.

fromTime.description: ignore events prior to this time

confidenceLevel.description: confidence level for statistics calculations; in range (0, 1)

effectSize.description: effect size of interest; in range [-1, 1]

metric.description: ask if you're interested, otherwise ignore

isSingleShot.description: ask if you're interested, otherwise ignore

Parameters.description: Input parameters for the Analytics APIs.

hasSufficientData.description: if sufficient data has been collected to observe the effect size of interest

fractionDataCollected.description: fraction of data that has been collected to observe the effect size of interest

profile.description: a map of key/value user attributes

total.description: Reflects the total number of users who have tried for an assignment

bucketAssignments.description: Reflects the total number of users who been assigned to a bucket

nullAssignments.description: Reflects the total number of users who have been delivered null assignments

contactOkay.description: boolean indicating that it's okay to contact the user

role.description: Role associated with the user for a given application
